actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3433.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3433 — "To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act with respect to molecularly targeted pediatric cancer investigations, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2706.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2706 — "To prohibit discrimination on the basis of mental or physical disability in cases of organ transplants."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3884.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3884 — "To amend title XI of the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize the program providing for sickle cell disease and other heritable blood disorders research, surveillance, prevention, and treatment."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 134.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 134 — "To require an annual budget estimate for the initiatives of the National Institutes of Health pursuant to reports and recommendations made under the National Alzheimer's Project Act."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 133.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 133 — "To extend the National Alzheimer's Project."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8108.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8108 — "To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to add a Medicaid State plan requirement with respect to the determination of residency of certain individuals serving in the Armed Forces."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6829.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6829 — "To amend the Public Health Service Act to authorize and support the creation and dissemination of cardiomyopathy education, awareness, and risk assessment materials and resources to identify more at-risk families, to authorize research and surveillance activities relating to cardiomyopathy, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5867.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. LaTurner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5867 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 109 Live Oaks Boulevard in Casselberry, Florida, as the "Colonel Joseph William Kittinger II Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6633.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. LaTurner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6633 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 9355 113th Street in Seminole, Florida, as the "Army SSG Ryan Christian Knauss Memorial Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3851.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. LaTurner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3851 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 90 McCamly Street South in Battle Creek, Michigan, as the "Sojourner Truth Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3640.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. LaTurner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3640 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 155 South Main Street in Mount Clemens, Michigan, as the "Lieutenant Colonel Alexander Jefferson Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3639.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. LaTurner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3639 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 2075 West Stadium Boulevard in Ann Arbor, Michigan, as the "Robert Hayden Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2685.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. LaTurner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2685 — "To make data and internal guidance on excess personal property publicly available, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1549.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. LaTurner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1549 — "To provide the Congressional Budget Office with necessary authorities to expedite the sharing of data from executive branch agencies, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Self to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Dr. Ralph B. Lassiter, St. Mark Baptist Church, Omaha, NE.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 23.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Debbie Lesko to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
